intro: Cycnia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny cycnia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Cycnia spinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
